docs.snippet: A rural area of about forty-two square miles extending from Westchester County into Fairfield County, Connecticut, was officially recommended yesterday as first choice for the permanent headquarters of the United Nations Organization.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Feb. 6 (U.P.)--Uruguay temporarily withdrew a proposal of clemency for German war criminals after a heated exchange today between Uruguayan and Russian delegates to the United Nations Organization.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Feb. 9--The controversial issue of the United Nations' permanent home reached a temper-splitting climax today as the Headquarters Committee of the General Assembly voted 19 to 19 on a French proposal to postpone the choice of a site for perma...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Feb. 9--The controversial issue of the United Nations' permanent home reached a temper-splitting climax today as the Headquarters Committee of the General Assembly voted 19 to 19 on a French proposal to postpone the choice of a site for perma nent headquarters at least until the next session of the Assembly in September.
docs.abstract: Assembly Hdqrs Com rept in tie vote on French proposal to postpone choice of permanent site until Sept Assembly conf; snarl discussed; Netherlands proposes NY as interim site and Stamford-Greenwich as permanent site; Indian delegate scores nations attempt to reverse Preparatory Comm decision to place permanent hdqrs in eastern US; com roll-call on French proposal noted; San Francisco bid renewed

headline.main: Site Issue Is Snarled by Tie On Delay in Assembly Group; SITE ISSUE SNARLED BY UNO DEADLOCK

byline.original: By SYDNEY GRUSON By Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Feb. 11--The Headquarters Committee of the United Nations, after a week of dramatic maneuvering, voted, 22 to 17, tonight to place the organization's permanent headquarters in "the general region" of Westchester County, N.Y., and Fairfield...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Feb. 11--The Headquarters Committee of the United Nations, after a week of dramatic maneuvering, voted, 22 to 17, tonight to place the organization's permanent headquarters in "the general region" of Westchester County, N.Y., and Fairfield County, Conn.
docs.abstract: proposed site wins in com by 22 to 17 vote; close fight in Assembly seen; nations roll-call noted; situation discussed
